arguments.li: Remove all research restrictions from HAR races
This will allow all races to research all research projects. Useful if you use mods like Random Research, since it might choose a project restricted to some race you don't have and you will be stuck.
Remove all custom thoughts from HAR races

Removes all custom thoughts, making them identical to vanilla human thoughts. Might make the game more balanced by reintroducing mood debuffs to races that had them disabled, and also might slightly improve performance.
Add a research for dubs mint storage
Tribals can't build high tech deep storage anymore! Adds a required research after microelectronics.
Fixes several animal tame revenge chances being 0.28% instead of 28%.
Chalicotherium, Procoptodon, Castoroides, Sivatherium, Macrauchenia, Megaloceros
Fantasy Metals Reforge deep drilling rebalance
Makes metals from this mod rarer. Otherwise it is harder to get vanilla materials, and those materials are expensive, making it too easy to sell them.
commonalities reduced from 0.3 to 0.03, halved lump sizes and portion sizes.
Items made from solpyrite will have "solpyrite" adjective instead of "golden?"
Great Memory trait increases learning speed
If you've disabled skill degradation, great memory trait does nothing. This patch makes it increase learning speed.
Significantly increases barrel sizes and removes rearm cost (reduces it to 1). Affects all vanilla and modded turrets, but not mortars.
xpath: affects all buildings with ShootingAccuracyTurret statbase. Sets fuelCapacity and fuelMultiplier to 10000.
3 times less damage, adds gunsmithing and gun turrets research requirements.
Replaces projectile from Bullet_MiniTurret with a custom one with damage 11 > 4, speed 70 > 35. Range 29 > 23
Three times lower recharge rate and capacity. Without this patch, ranged shield belt is only about 10 % weaker than normal shield belt, making it very OP.
Fix being unable to equip some vanilla weapons
Nerubians has a bug which makes all other races unable to equip some vanilla weapons, this fixes that. Please tell the mod author to replace /alienRace/raceRestriction/weaponList with whiteWeaponList
xpath: removes weaponList node from race with defName="Nerubian".
Adds a filter for all items that can rot unless frozen, except corpses (including all modded items). IMPORTANT: Doesn't include meat because that apparently requires c#
The filter is at the bottom of the list, I don't know an xml way to move it to the top.
Fix some modded factions not showing up in create world menu
Some modded factions have a bug where they don't appear in create world menu, this setting fixes that.
xpath: adds maxConfigurableAtWorldCreation=9999 to all non-hidden non-player non-abstract factions that aren't based on anything other than factionBase and don't already have this line.
Fixes research oversights in mods. For example, all gun researches should require gunsmithing/gunpowder.
this xpath contains a manually collected list of rules for adding research requirements.

Corrects text typos in mods. For example, renames "crocodale" to "crocodile", "leopardgecko" to "leopard gecko", etc. Currently does a complete retranslation of HC_Animal_1, HC_Animal_2, HC_Animal_3, HC_Animal_4.
this xpath contains a manually collected list of rules for replacing texts with corrected versions.
Removes duplicate materials and patches everything to use new materials.
this xpath contains a manually collected list of rules for removing materials when appropriate mods are loaded.

This will remove duplicate animals from mods. Vanilla Expanded mods are the highest priority and animals from them won't be removed. For example, if both VE and ACP add a Cheetah, it will be deleted from ACP. Some animals are renamed instead where appropriate.

this xpath contains a manually collected list of rules for removing animals when appropriate mods are loaded. Removes ThingDef, PawnKindDef and egg ThingDef. When a higher priority mod is detected, it tries to remove duplicate animals from lower priority mods. You can see the mod priority on TPatches Google Sheets.
